summary: Cyber threats to systems that provide essential services such as banking and health care are growing. A 2022 law required the Department of Homeland Security to take several actions to address these threats. The first set of requirements for DHS included proposing a rule that identifies which infrastructure operators have to report about cyber incidents. DHS proposed the rule in March 2024. According to DHS...
title: Critical Infrastructure Protection: DHS Has Efforts Underway to Implement Federal Incident Reporting Requirements
